intro: Gentlea cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gentian, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are tubular and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
